intro: Krassera dajakorum, commonly known as the Dajakorum bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes various bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and prefers well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
